titleInfo.title: Oral history interview with David K. Wilson, 2006 September 13, excerpt 05

physicalDescription.note: Excerpted from: NBLWilsonD digital recording converted from wav to mp3 format in 2006.

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville business and civic leader David Kirkpatrick "Pat" Wilson, conducted on 13 September 2006 by Cabot Pyle and Kenneth L. Roberts as part of the Nashville Public Library's Nashville Business Leaders Oral History Project: The Turner Interviews. Wilson discusses banking in Nashville during the 1940s. He discusses three competitor banks--First American, Commerce Union, and Third National--and how Sam Fleming of Third National was the first banker in Nashville to become a public figure. The complete interview, as well as an index, is available in the repository.

titleInfo.title: Nashville Business Leaders Oral History Project
